page.name: Instructor's Welcome Message
page.content:
Dear Instructor,

It is important to welcome your students to the course and let them know how to get started. Thus, one week before the start of the course, please post an announcement to the Course Announcements forum. All enrolled students will receive a copy of that post via their university email account. Since students do enroll into the course late, you should re-post the same announcement a couple of days before the course and a day into the course. Feel free to copy-and-paste the sample message below and tweak it as desired, as it contains the most important information to help students get started.

The boilerplate welcome message below has all the essential information students need but may need some tweaking and personalizing by you. Because students will register late, instructors should ideally send out the welcome message three times: the week before the course officially starts, the official start date of the course, and two days after the official start date. In the second and third mailings, you can preface the welcome message with language like, "For the benefit of those students who have recently joined the class, we are sending out the welcome message information again."

Important: be certain you have made the course available to students before sending out the welcome message; otherwise, students will not receive the message and will not have access to the course. See Making Course Sites Visible for instructions on how to make your course available to students.

--Center for Innovation in Teaching & Learning (CITL)

Note: This page is "hidden" (grayed-out on the homepage), meaning it (and others like it) are not visible to students.
